Description: Limestone stela of Harmin: there are three sections to this round-topped stela. In the upper register the ship's captain, Pata(?), kneels on the right in adoration of Osiris, Horus and Isis; before him is an altar on which rests a water-pot cooled by a lotus blossom. In the second register the follower Harmin, the lady of the house Astniut, the stable-master Bakaa, the porter Ipy and the lady of the house Mery squat in a row before a pile of offerings on the right. The third section of the register consists of a prayer in two lines to Osiris and Anubis on behalf of Harmin. The edges of the stela are slightly damaged, and there are gouges on the surface. A nodule of rock remains in the left-hand lower corner. Traces of yellow can be seen on some of the figures.
Production place: Workshop in: Abydos (based on style and content)
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Abydos (based on style and content)
Curator's comments: Bibliography: The British Museum, 'A guide to the Egyptian galleries (Sculpture)' (London, 1909), 218 (no. 788).
Bibliographic references: Bierbrier 1993 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum, Part 12. (Pl.70-71)
Condition: The edges of the stela are slightly damaged, and there are gouges on the surface. A nodule of rock remains in the left-hand lower corner.
